definition[0]: a person or organization that officially gives something such as a document to people who need or want it
example[0]: Several credit card issuers now charge an annual fee for the use of their card.
definition[1]: a company that makes its SECURITIES (=bonds, shares etc) available for sale
example[1]: Another stimulus to the market has come from issuers buying back bonds.
definition[2]: a bank or government that issues currency in the form of BANKNOTEs and coins, making them officially available
example[2]: The Bankâ€™s function as the issuer of currency notes is separate from its banking activities.
